message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <object name> PLACE <location>
2) WAIT
Only PICK an object if your gripper is empty. Target <location> for PLACE should be panel or a bin.
[Action Output Instruction]
You must first output 'EXECUTE
', then give **exactly** one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example: 'EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK red_square PLACE panel3
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION PICK green_trapezoid PLACE panel6
'

[History]
== Round#0 ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
I apologize for the mistake. Chad, since you can't reach panel3, please place the blue_square on panel5 as you initially proposed. 

So the updated plan is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel3
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
[Executed Action]
Alice: PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel3
Bob: WAIT
Chad: PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
== Round#1 ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Bob, Chad, our goal is to place the blue_square on panel2. Since I can't reach the blue_square, one of you will need to move it to a panel I can reach. 

Bob, can you please pick up the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3? Then, I can pick it up and place it on panel2 in the next round.

PROCEED
[Bob]:
Alice, I understand our goal is to place the blue_square on panel2. I can pick up the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 for you to reach it in the next round. 

So my proposed action is:
NAME Bob ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3

Chad, please confirm if you agree with this plan.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
Alice, Bob, I agree with the plan. Our goal is to place the yellow_trapezoid on panel6, and I can do that once the blue_square is moved.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Alice: WAIT
Bob: PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
Chad: WAIT
== Round#2 ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Bob, Chad, thank you for moving the blue_square to panel3. Now I can pick it up and place it on panel2, which is our goal.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Bob]:
Alice, that sounds good. Since our goal is to place the pink_polygon on panel4, I can pick it up from panel3 and place it on panel4 in the next round.

So for this round, I will wait as you move the blue_square to panel2.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
Alice, Bob, I agree with the plan. Once the blue_square is placed on panel2, I can focus on placing the yellow_trapezoid on panel6.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Alice: PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
Bob: WAIT
Chad: WAIT
== Round#3 ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Bob, Chad, now that the blue_square is on panel2, we can focus on placing the pink_polygon on panel4 and the yellow_trapezoid on panel6.

Bob, since you can reach panel4, please pick up the pink_polygon from panel3 and place it on panel4. Chad, you can pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on panel6.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
[Bob]:
Alice, I agree with the plan. I will pick up the pink_polygon from panel3 and place it on panel4. Chad, please pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on panel6.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
[Chad]:
Alice, Bob, I cannot reach panel3 to pick up the yellow_trapezoid. Bob, after you place the pink_polygon on panel4, please pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on panel5 so I can reach it.

For this round, I will wait.

PROCEED
[Alice]:
Chad, I apologize for the oversight. You're right, you can't reach panel3. 

Bob, please proceed with placing the pink_polygon on panel4. In the next round, you can move the yellow_trapezoid to panel5 for Chad.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Alice: WAIT
Bob: PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
Chad: WAIT
== Round#4 ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Bob, Chad, thank you for placing the pink_polygon on panel4. Now, we need to move the yellow_trapezoid to panel6. 

Bob, please pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on panel5 so Chad can reach it. Chad, please wait for the yellow_trapezoid to be moved to panel5.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel5
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Bob]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
Alice, I agree with the plan. I will wait for Bob to move the yellow_trapezoid to panel5 so I can reach it and place it on panel6.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel5
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Alice: WAIT
Bob: PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel5
Chad: WAIT
== Current Round ==


7 panels on the table, ordered left to right: panel1,...,panel7. They form a straight assembly line, panel1 is closed to panel2 and farthest from panel7.
You are robot Alice in front of panel2. You are collaborating with Bob, Chad to sort cubes into their target panels. The task is NOT done until all three cubes are sorted.
At current round: 
blue_square is in panel2
pink_polygon is in panel4
yellow_trapezoid is on panel5
Your goal is to place blue_square on panel2, but you can only reach panel1, panel2, panel3: this means you can only pick cubes from these panels, and can only place cubes on these panels.
Your gripper is empty, can reach cubes: blue_square, can't reach cubes: pink_polygon, yellow_trapezoid, 
Never forget you are Alice! Never forget you can only reach panel1, panel2, panel3!
Think step-by-step about the task and others' response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].

When you respond, tell others about your goal and all constraints. Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said.
Discuss with others to come up with the best plan, e.g. if your cube is out of your reach, ask others for help, and you can do the same for them. 
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) output PROCEED, if the plans require further discussion, or 2) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output EXECUTE and the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
In the plan, at least one robot should be acting, you can't all WAIT.
You are Alice, your response is:

Chad, now that the yellow_trapezoid is on panel5, you can pick it up and place it on panel6, which is our goal. Bob and I will wait.

So the plan for this round is:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
